data.title: Junior BJJ belt conversion when one becomes an adult
data.meta_description:
Junior BJJ belts are different from adult ones. How are they converted when a junior becomes an adult?

data.text:
Junior BJJ belts are different from adult ones. How are they converted when a junior becomes an adult?

So let's say I'm 15 and have Orange belt. When I turn 17 should I start from White again or will I receive a Blue, Purple etc?

There is no official method since every school has different rules. However, it is quite standard to convert all the belts from the yellow up to a blue belt. This is because there is normally no sense in letting these former under-16 people fight against white belts. On the other side, if they are much better than a blue belt they will prove it quickly during competitions and they will then be rewarded with the purple belt.

answered Jun 22, 2013 at 8:43

Edgar DerbyEdgar Derby
